intro: Sida oligophylla, commonly known as the smallleaf sida, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas. It is a herbaceous annual or perennial plant that typically grows to a height of 30–100 cm. The plant features small, ovate leaves with a rough texture and produces clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers. Sida oligophylla is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of habitats, including roadsides and fields. Its fibrous roots and rapid growth make it a common weed in agricultural areas.
